page.title: 09Religion in Stock
page.content: When our Catholic Church called Our Lady of Mount Carmel was first built in 1892 it was a school but in 1977 it had to close because of the falling pupil rolls.The building then became the Church.The priest is Father John Glyn who has been in charge for 5 years.His Congregation is about 100 people including children and teenagers,with a small choir.They have a summer fete each year.The Roman Catholic Bishop lives in Stock at the Bishop's house but Father Glyn lives in Ingatestone.Every sunday there is a mass at 9.30 am.In the meadowland around the Catholic Church Roman remains have been found.Much land in Stock was owned by Lord Petre who was a strong Roman Catholic.
